00022 #ifndef _PRIORSREADER_H_
00023 #define _PRIORSREADER_H_
00024 
00025 //
00026 #ifndef WIN32
00027 #include <dirent.h>
00028 #endif
00029 #include "birdseed-dev/Clusters.h"
00030 #include "birdseed-dev/Prior.h"
00031 //
00032 #include "broadutil/BroadException.h"
00033 #include "chipstream/SpecialSnps.h"

00036 #include <map>
00037 #include <memory>
00038 #include <set>
00039 #include <string>
00040 //
00041 
00042 // Classes:
00043 // + BasicPriorsReader (virtual)
00044 //    + BasicMapPriorsReader (keeps data in a std::map)
00045 //      + TextPriorsReader   (the broad text   format)
00046 //      + TsvPriorsReader    (the affy  text   format)
00047 //    + BinaryPriorsReader   (the broad binary format)
00048 //
00049 static const char BIRDSEED_SUFFIX_CHAR = 'm';
00050 
00051 namespace birdseed
00052 {
00053 namespace dev {
00054 class BasicPriorsReader
00055 {
00056 public:
00057   // Includes optional gender character.  Is this big enough?
00058   enum {kMaxPriorNameLen = 31};
00059 
00060   // Let
00061   struct NamedPriors {
00062     NamedPriors(size_t numPriors):
00063         priorName(),
00064         priors(numPriors) {}
00065 
00066     char priorName[kMaxPriorNameLen+1];
00067     Priors priors;
00068   };
00069 
00070   virtual ~BasicPriorsReader() {};
00071 
00072   // The caller should not delete the returned object.
00073   // The lifetime of the returned object is only guaranteed
00074   // until the next call to getPrior() or until
00075   // the PriorsReader is destroyed.  If a caller wants the information
00076   // for longer than that, a copy must be made.
00077   virtual const Priors* getPrior(const std::string &priorName) = 0;
00078 
00079   // Set prior iteration back to the beginning
00080   virtual void startPriorIteration() = 0;
00081   // Returns a different prior name with each call, in arbitrary order.
00082   // Returns NULL when iteration is done.  prior name may have "m" appended
00083   // to it if it is the male version of the prior.
00084   /// @remarks This interacts with nextPrior().  (It shares the iterator.)
00085   virtual const char *nextPriorName() = 0;
00086 
00087   /// @brief     Get the next name and prior info
00088   /// @param     cur_name   pointer to the std::string to modify.
00089   /// @param     cur_priors pointer to the Priors object to modify
00090   /// @return    false when at the end of the data.
00091   /// @remarks   must call startPriorIteration() to get to the beginning.
00092   virtual bool nextPrior(std::string* cur_name, Priors* cur_priors) = 0;
00093 
00094   /// @brief     Get the next name (without suffix indicating ploidy) and prior info
00095   /// @param     cur_name   pointer to the std::string to modify.
00096   /// @param     cur_priors pointer to the Priors object to modify
00097   /// @return    false when at the end of the data.
00098   /// @remarks   must call startPriorIteration() to get to the beginning.
00099   bool nextPriorWithoutPloidySuffix(std::string* cur_name, Priors* cur_priors);
00100 
00101   // This is only guaranteed to return a valid answer if called after startPriorIteration()
00102   virtual size_t numPriors() = 0;
00103 
00104   /// @brief     Write the collection of priors to a file.
00105   /// @param     outputFile   path of the output file.
00106   /// @param     chipType     chipType to write into the file (not used by all formats.)
00107   /// @remarks   The format of the file will be taken from the ending of the outputFile.
00108   ///            The endings allowed by this function are:
00109   ///            ".priors" => Broad Binary.
00110   ///            ".tsv" => Affy Tsv.
00111   ///            ".txt" => Broad Text.
00112   void writePriorsFile(std::string outputFile, std::string chipType);
00113   /// @brief     Write the collection of priors to a file.
00114   /// @param     outputFile   path of the output file.
00115   /// @param     chipType     ignored by this file format.
00116   void writeTextPriorsFile(std::string outputFile, std::string chipType);
00117   /// @brief     Write the collection of priors to a file.
00118   /// @param     outputFile   path of the output file.
00119   /// @param     chipType     chipType to write into the file.
00120   void writeTsvPriorsFile(std::string outputFile, std::string chipType);
00121   /// @brief     Write the collection of priors to a file.
00122   /// @param     outputFile   path of the output file.
00123   /// @param     chipType     chipType to write into the file.
00124   void writeBinaryPriorsFile(std::string outputFile, std::string chipType);
00125 };
00126 
00127 /** A class which contains the map used by the Tsv and Text format which subclass it. */
00128 class BasicMapPriorsReader: public BasicPriorsReader
00129 {
00130 protected:
00131   /// A handy typedef
00132   typedef std::map<std::string, Priors> PriorsMap;
00133   /// Both Text and Tsv formats keep their data in a std::map.
00134   PriorsMap priorsMap;
00135   /// An iterator over the map data.
00136   PriorsMap::const_iterator priorIt;
00137 public:
00138   virtual void startPriorIteration();
00139   virtual const char *nextPriorName();
00140   virtual bool nextPrior(std::string* cur_name, Priors* cur_priors);
00141   virtual const Priors* getPrior(const std::string &priorName);
00142   virtual size_t numPriors();
00143 };
00144 
00145 /** Used to read the Broad Text Priors format. */
00146 class TextPriorsReader: public BasicMapPriorsReader
00147 {
00148 public:
00149   TextPriorsReader(std::string path);
00150 };
00151 
00152 /** Used to read the Affy Tsv Priors format. */
00153 class TsvPriorsReader: public BasicMapPriorsReader
00154 {
00155 public:
00156   TsvPriorsReader(std::string path, std::set<const char *, Util::ltstr> *probeSetsToLoad = NULL);
00157   const Priors* getPrior(const std::string &priorName);
00158 };
00159 
00160 /** Used to read the Broad Binary Priors format.  Rather
00161     than using a std::map like Tsv and Text, a counter is
00162     used to walk the Priors.  This means that all the
00163     iterator methods have different implementations than
00164     the other two.
00165  */
00166 class BinaryPriorsReader: public BasicPriorsReader
00167 {
00168 public:
00169   static const char *kDefaultChipType;
00170 
00171 private:
00172   // Start of memory-mapped area
00173   void *pMMap;
00174   size_t mappedSize;
00175   size_t countPriors;
00176   // These are sorted by prior name
00177   const NamedPriors *allPriors;
00178   size_t priorIndex;
00179 
00180 public:
00181   BinaryPriorsReader(std::string path, std::string expectedChipType = kDefaultChipType);
00182   ~BinaryPriorsReader();
00183   const Priors *getPrior(const std::string &priorName);
00184 
00185   void startPriorIteration();
00186   bool nextPrior(std::string* cur_name, Priors* cur_priors);
00187   const char *nextPriorName();
00188   virtual size_t numPriors();
00189 };
00190 
00191 // Object that encapsulates our naming conventions for special (chrX, chrY, chrM, etc.) snps
00192 class SnpPriorKey
00193 {
00194 
00195 public:
00196   // sMap is assumed to have lifetime longer than SnpPriorKey, since we hang onto a reference
00197   // rather than copying it over and over again.
00198   SnpPriorKey(const SpecialSnpMap &sMap):
00199       specialSnps(sMap) {
00200   }
00201 
00202   bool ploidyDiffersByGender(const char *snpName) const;
00203 
00204   // Return a string based on the number of chromosomes expected given the gender.
00205   // for example a chrX snp in males has 1 copy so expected is: 'snpname-1' and a
00206   // chrY snp in females has 0 copies so expected is: 'snpname-0'. regular autosomal
00207   // snps would be 'snpname-2'
00208   std::string priorKeyForSnp(const std::string &snpName, Gender gender) const;
00209 
00210 private:
00211   /// Map of snp names to the copies in males and females.
00212   const SpecialSnpMap &specialSnps;
00213 
00214 };
00215 
00216 template<class BASICPRIORSREADER, class PRIORS>
00217 class PriorsReaderTemplate
00218 {
00219 public:
00220   // Note that it is the responsibility of this class to destroy the basicReader
00221   // when it is done with it.
00222   // specialSnps is assumed to have lifetime longer than this class, since we hang onto a reference
00223   // rather than copying it over and over again.
00224   PriorsReaderTemplate(const SpecialSnpMap &specialSnps, BASICPRIORSREADER *basicReader):
00225       snpKey(specialSnps),
00226       basicPriorsReader(basicReader) {
00227   }
00228 
00229   bool ploidyDiffersByGender(const char *snpName) {
00230     return snpKey.ploidyDiffersByGender(snpName);
00231   }
00232 
00233   // The caller should not delete the returned object.
00234   // The lifetime of the returned object is only guaranteed
00235   // until the next call to getPriorsForSNP() or until
00236   // the PriorsReader is destroyed.  If a caller wants the information
00237   // for longer than that, a copy must be made.
00238   const PRIORS *getPriorsForSNP(const char *snpName, Gender gender = GENDER_UNKNOWN) {
00239     return basicPriorsReader->getPrior(getPriorName(snpName, gender).c_str());
00240   }
00241 
00242   // Look up the key using our "special" (i.e. chrY, chrX, chrM) snps aware object
00243   std::string getPriorName(const char *snpName, Gender gender = GENDER_UNKNOWN) {
00244     return snpKey.priorKeyForSnp(snpName, gender);
00245   }
00246 
00247   size_t numPriors() {
00248     return basicPriorsReader->numPriors();
00249   }
00250 private:
00251   // Object that encapsulates oure naming conventions for special snps.
00252   SnpPriorKey snpKey;
00253   std::auto_ptr<BASICPRIORSREADER> basicPriorsReader;
00254 };
00255 
00256 typedef PriorsReaderTemplate<BasicPriorsReader, Priors> PriorsReader;
00257 
00258 };
00259 };
00260 #endif /* _PRIORSREADER_H_ */
